meanings.definition: Scientists who study pollen and spores.
meanings.sent1: Palynologists use microscopes to examine pollen and spores.
meanings.sent2: The palynologists collected samples from different plants to study.
meanings.sent3: The palynologists joked that they had 'pollen in their veins' because they loved their work so much.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nature detectives, palynologists are the pollen sleuths.
meanings.sent5: The palynologists' lab was filled with colorful images of pollen grains under the microscope.

meanings.definition: Those who analyze and interpret pollen samples.
meanings.sent1: Palynologists carefully analyze each pollen sample under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The palynologists compared the pollen samples from different regions.
meanings.sent3: The palynologists were so good at their job, they could 'read' the history of an area just by looking at pollen.
meanings.sent4: To the untrained eye, palynologists seemed like wizards deciphering the language of pollen.
meanings.sent5: The palynologists' expertise in interpreting pollen samples was unmatched in the scientific community.

meanings.definition: Experts in the field of palynology.
meanings.sent1: Palynologists are considered the top experts in the study of pollen and spores.
meanings.sent2: The palynologists' research has greatly advanced our understanding of plant reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The palynologists were so knowledgeable that they could identify a plant just by looking at its pollen.
meanings.sent4: In the world of botany, palynologists are the gurus of pollen analysis.
meanings.sent5: The palynologists' conference was a gathering of the brightest minds in palynology.
